name: Mathematical Foundations for Machine Learning
description: Mathematical foundations essential for machine learning including linear algebra, calculus, probability, and statistics.
objectives: Apply mathematical concepts to machine learning problems
Understand linear algebra operations in ML
Master probability and statistics for ML
Solve optimization problems in ML

units.title: Linear Transformations – I
topics: Determinant of large matrices and computational complexity

units.title: Vector Norms and Inner Product Spaces

textBooks: Mathematics for Machine Learning – M.P. Deisenroth, A. Aldo Faisal, C. Ong, Cambridge, 2020
Linear Algebra and Its Applications – D.C. Lay et al., Pearson, 2021
Linear Algebra: An Introduction – R. Bronson & G. Costa, Academic Press, 2007
referenceBooks: Linear Algebra and Optimization for Machine Learning – Charu Aggarwal, Springer, 2020
Linear Algebra – S. Friedberg et al., Pearson, 2019
Schaum's Outline: Linear Algebra – Lipschutz & Lipson, McGraw Hill, 2017
courseOutcomes: Apply calculus and linear algebra concepts to ML problems
Implement mathematical concepts in ML using modern tools

name: Computer Organization and Architecture
description: Covers the basic functional blocks of a computer, instruction set architecture, data representation, computer arithmetic, CPU design, memory systems, and pipelining.
objectives: Comprehend the basic principles and components of computer architecture.
Apply principles of computer organization and architecture to improve the performance of computer systems.
Analyze the performance of different computer architectures and evaluate trade-offs in terms of speed, cost, and energy consumption.

units.title: Basic Functional Blocks
topics: CPU, memory, I/O subsystems, control unit
Instruction set architecture, execution cycle, addressing modes

units.title: Data Representation and Computer Arithmetic
topics: Integer addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division

units.title: CPU Control Unit and Memory Design
Peripheral Devices and I/O
topics: I/O transfers (program controlled, interrupt driven, DMA)
Privileged instructions, software interrupts and exceptions

units.title: Pipelining and Memory Organization
topics: Basic concepts of pipelining, throughput, speedup, hazards

textBooks: Computer Organization and Design: The Hardware/Software Interface, David A. Patterson and John L. Hennessy, 4th, Elsevier, 2011
Computer Architecture and Organization, John P. Hayes, McGraw Hill, 2017
referenceBooks: Computer Organization, Carl Hamacher, 5th Edition, McGraw Hill Publishers, 2019
courseOutcomes: Comprehend the basic principles and components of computer architecture.
Apply principles of computer organization and architecture to improve the performance of computer systems.
Analyze the performance of different computer architectures and evaluate trade-offs in terms of speed, cost, and energy consumption.

name: Data Structures
description: A comprehensive course on fundamental data structures including linked lists, stacks, queues, trees, and their applications.
objectives: Design various methodology for organizing data and solving basic programming challenges using Linear Data Structures.
Apply the concepts of Linear Data Structures and Recursive techniques to handle problems in real time applications through programming.
Analyze and implement application based real time solutions using Non-linear Data structures.

units.title: Introduction to Linked Lists
topics: Singly Linked List operations and applications

units.title: Advanced Linked Lists and Stacks
topics: Doubly Linked Lists, Circular Linked List
Stack implementation and applications (Infix to postfix)

units.title: Recursion and Queues
topics: Queue implementation and types (Circular, Deque, priority)

units.title: Binary Trees
topics: Binary Search Trees operations and applications

textBooks: Data Structures and algorithms in Python, Michael T. Goodrich, Roberto Tamassia, Michel H Goldwasser, John Wiley & Sons, Incorporated, 2013
Python Data Structures and Algorithms, Benjamin Baka, Packt Publishing Ltd, 2017
referenceBooks: Data Structures and Algorithmic Thinking with Python, by Narasimha Krumanchi, 1st Edition, Career Monk Publications, 2015
courseOutcomes: Design various methodology for organizing data and solving basic programming challenges using Linear Data Structures.
Apply the concepts of Linear Data Structures and Recursive techniques to handle problems in real time applications through programming.
Analyze and implement application based real time solutions using Non-linear Data structures.

name: Probability and Statistics for Machine Learning
description: This course covers foundational concepts in probability and statistics essential for machine learning, including Bayesian probability, random variables, and descriptive statistics.
objectives: Analyze real time challenges based on distribution of data and predict future estimations.
Apply statistical knowledge to understand uncertainty and formulate automated solutions.
Analyze the relationship between features and apply algorithms to handle data efficiently.

units.title: Continuous Random variables
topics: Pareto Distribution and Central Limit Theorem

units.title: Introduction to statistics
topics: Population and sample, parameters and statistics
Mean, Median, Quantiles, Variance, Standard Deviation

textBooks: Probability and Statistics for Computer Scientists, Michael Baron, CRC press, 2019
Probability for machine learning Discover how to harness uncertainty with Python, Jason Brownlee
referenceBooks: Probability, Statistics, Queuing theory and Computer Science Applications, Kishore S Trivedi, 2nd Edition, Willey Publishers, 2008
courseOutcomes: Analyze the real time challenges based on distribution of data, predict future estimations using the concept of probability and acquire skills to better handle the present situation.
Apply statistical knowledge to understand the uncertainty in daily applications and formulate automated solutions.
Analyze the relationship between the features extracted from the samples and apply the learnt algorithms to handle data efficiently.

name: Object Oriented Programming
description: An introduction to Object-Oriented Programming principles including classes, objects, encapsulation, abstraction, inheritance, and polymorphism, as well as concurrency and memory management.
objectives: Exhibit object-oriented programming paradigm to enhance code reusability.
Design and Model efficient class and object interaction mechanisms.
Demonstrate object-oriented principles and practices through modern tools.

units.title: Introduction to Classes and Objects
topics: Defining and calling functions in classes

units.title: Concurrency
topics: Processes and Threads, Thread life cycle
Synchronizing Threads, Inter-Thread Communication, Thread Deadlock

units.title: Memory Management and Timers
topics: Object lifetime, Reference count, Garbage collection

textBooks: Programming Languages: Principles and Paradigms, springer, Maurizio Gabbrielli, Simone Martini, 2nd Edition, Springer, 2023
Python 3 object-oriented programming, 2nd Edition, Dusty Phillips, 2015
referenceBooks: Object oriented python, Irv Kalb, 2022
courseOutcomes: Exhibit object-oriented programming paradigm to enhance code reusability.
Design and Model efficient class and object interaction mechanisms using Object-oriented problem-solving techniques.
Demonstrate object-oriented principles and practices through modern tools.

name: Database Management Systems
description: This course covers fundamentals of database systems, including data modeling, relational models, database design, transaction processing, storage, indexing, and an introduction to NoSQL databases.
objectives: Apply and Analyze the concepts of database management system for various real-world applications.
Develop and exhibit a conceptual framework for business applications through design and demonstration.
Conduct experiments to showcase the practical application of query processing techniques.

units.title: Introduction to Databases
topics: Three schema architecture and Data Independence

units.title: Conceptual Relational Data Modeling
topics: Entity Types, Sets, Attributes, Relationship Types

units.title: Database Design and Transaction Processing
topics: Transaction Concepts, Desirable Properties of Transactions

units.title: Storage and Indexing
topics: Indexing and Hashing (B+ tree, B Tree, Static/Dynamic Hashing)

units.title: NoSQL
topics: Types of NoSQL Databases, CAP theorem

textBooks: Fundamentals of Database Systems, Ramez Elmasri and Shamkant B. Navathe, 5th Edition, Pearson Education, 2008
referenceBooks: Database System Concepts, Abraham Silberschatz, Henry F. Korth and S. Sudarshan, 6th Edition, Tata Mc Graw Hill, 2011
courseOutcomes: Apply and Analyze the concepts of database management system for various real-world applications.
Develop and exhibit a conceptual framework for business applications through the process of design and demonstration.
Conduct experiments to showcase the practical application of query processing techniques.

name: Theoretical Foundations of Computations
description: A course on the theory of computation, covering finite automata, regular languages, context-free grammars, pushdown automata, and Turing machines.
objectives: Apply formal notations with related concepts to provide a basic construct of computation.
Analyze the constructs of a machine representation of formal languages.
Design formal machines that can recognize patterns and syntaxes of mathematical models.

units.title: Regular Languages and Expressions
topics: Proving Languages Not to be Regular
Equivalence of FA and Regular Expressions

textBooks: An Introduction to Formal Languages and Automata, Peter Linz, 6th Edition, Jones & Bartlett Learning, 2017
referenceBooks: Introduction to Automata Theory, Languages and Computation, John E. Hopcroft, Rajeev Motwani, Jeffrey D. Ullman, 3rd Edition, Pearson, 2007
courseOutcomes: Apply formal notations with related concepts to provide basic construct of computation.
Analyze the constructs of a machine representation of formal languages and implement solutions towards designing of system software.
Design formal machines that can recognize the patterns and syntaxes of mathematical models.

name: Physical Education-1
description: A non-credit mandatory course focusing on physical education.

name: Mathematical Foundation for Machine Learning - 2
description: An advanced course on the mathematical foundations for machine learning, focusing on matrix operations, vector calculus, and optimization.
objectives: Appreciate the importance of linear algebra in computer and allied engineering science.
Gain the knowledge of linear algebra tools and concepts to implement them in their core domain.
Improve their mathematical thinking and acquire skills required for sustained lifelong learning.

units.title: Vector Calculus
topics: Gradients of vector-valued functions and matrices

units.title: Applications of Vector Calculus
topics: Gradient of Quadratic Cost and Mean Squared Error

units.title: Univariate Optimization
topics: Local and global optima, convex sets
Optimization using gradient descent and NR method

textBooks: Mathematics for Machine learning, Marc Peter Deisennroth, A. Aldo Faisal, Cheng Soon Ong, 2020, Cambridge University Press.
referenceBooks: Linear Algebra and Optimization for Machine Learning, Charu C. Aggarwal, Springer, 2020.
courseOutcomes: Apply the concepts of Calculus and Linear Algebra to problems in Machine learning.
Apply the concepts of Calculus and Linear Algebra to Machine learning through modern IT tools.

name: Operating Systems
description: This course provides a comprehensive overview of operating system concepts, including processes, threads, memory management, deadlocks, and file systems.
objectives: Apply the fundamental concepts of modern operating systems.
Analyze and solve operating system issues to improve system performance and reliability.
Design solutions for scheduling real-time applications to meet real-world demands effectively.

units.title: Inter-process Communication and Scheduling
topics: Race Conditions, Critical Regions, Semaphores, Mutexes
Case studies: Dining Philosophers, Readers and Writers

units.title: Memory Management
topics: Swapping, Contiguous memory allocation, Paging, Segmentation

units.title: File System
topics: File concept, Access methods, Directory structure

textBooks: Modern operating systems, Tanenbaum, Andrew, 4th Edition, Pearson Education, 2015.
Operating System Concepts, Abraham Silberschatz, Peter Baer Galvin, Greg Gagne, 9th Edition, Wiley India, 2013.
referenceBooks: Operating Systems: Internals and Design Principles, William Stallings, 9th Edition, Pearson, 2008.
courseOutcomes: Apply the fundamental concepts of modern operating systems.
Analyze and solve operating system issues, to improve system performance and reliability.
Design solutions for scheduling real-time applications to meet real-world demands effectively.

name: Design and Analysis of Algorithms
description: A course covering fundamental algorithm analysis techniques and various algorithm design strategies like brute force, divide and conquer, greedy, dynamic programming, and more.
objectives: Apply knowledge of computing and mathematics to algorithm analysis and design.
Analyze a problem and identify the time complexity of algorithms for an appropriate solution.
Assess the performance of different algorithms and their limitations.

units.title: Fundamentals of Algorithm Analysis
topics: Framework for Analysis of algorithm efficiency
Mathematical Analysis of Non recursive and Recursive algorithms

units.title: Brute Force, Divide and Conquer, Greedy Technique
Transform and Conquer, Dynamic Programming
topics: Binomial Coefficient, Floyd's Algorithm, Knapsack Problem

units.title: Limitations, Backtracking, Branch and Bound
topics: Decision Trees, P, NP and NP-Complete Problems
N queens problem, Sum of subset problem

textBooks: Introduction to the design and analysis of algorithms, by Anany Levitin, 3rd Edition, Pearson Education, 2023.
Computer Algorithms, by Horowitz E., Sahani S., Rajasekharan S., 3rd Edition, Universities Press, 2022.
referenceBooks: Introduction to Algorithms, Cormen T.H, Leiserson C. E, Rivest R.L, Stein C, 4th Edition, The MIT Press 2022.
courseOutcomes: Apply knowledge of computing and mathematics to algorithm analysis and design.
Analyze a problem and identify the time complexity of algorithms for an appropriate solution.
Assess the performance of different algorithms and their limitations.

name: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence
description: An introductory course to AI, covering intelligent agents, problem-solving, search strategies, knowledge representation, and expert systems.
objectives: Apply principles of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to solve real-world problems.
Analyze the performance and limitations of different search algorithms in solving Al problems.
Assess and provide solutions for Al based applications.

units.title: Introduction to AI and Uninformed Search
topics: Uniform Cost Search, Depth Limited Search

units.title: Knowledge Rules, Adversarial Search, and Uncertainty
Expert Systems
topics: Architecture and Roles of expert systems

textBooks: Artificial Intelligence - A Modern Approach, Stuart Russell and Peter Norvig, 4th Edition, Pearson, 2022.
Artificial Intelligence, Elaine Rich, Kevin Knight, Shivashankar B Nair, 3rd Edition, Mc Graw Hill Education, 2015.
referenceBooks: Introduction to Artificial Intelligence and Expert Systems, Dan W Patterson, 1st Edition, Pearson, 2015.
courseOutcomes: Apply principles of Artificial Intelligence (AI) to solve real-world problems.
Analyze the performance and limitations of different search algorithms in solving Al problems.
Assess and provide solutions for Al based applications.

name: Introduction to Machine Learning
description: An introductory course to machine learning, covering concept learning, supervised learning (decision trees, SVMs), Bayesian learning, unsupervised learning (clustering), and dimensionality reduction.
objectives: Apply the concepts of Machine Learning techniques to solve problems across various domains.
Analyze the given data for modeling and prediction using machine learning techniques.
Provide solutions for real time applications using Machine Learning techniques.

units.title: Bayesian and Ensemble Learning
topics: Naïve Bayes Classifier, Bayesian Belief Network, EM Algorithm

textBooks: Machine Learning, Tom Mitchell, McGraw Hill, 3rd Edition, 1997.
Introduction to Machine Learning, Ethem Alpaydın, 3rd Edition, MIT press, 2014.
referenceBooks: MACHINE LEARNING An Algorithmic Perspective, Stephen Marsland, 2nd Edition, 2015.
courseOutcomes: Apply the concepts of Machine Learning techniques to solve the problems across various domains.
Analyze the given data for modeling and prediction using machine learning techniques.
Provide solutions for real time applications using Machine Learning techniques.

name: Inferential Statistics
description: This course covers inferential statistics, including sampling techniques, hypothesis testing, and various statistical tests like t-test, F-test, and Chi-square test.
objectives: Apply appropriate sampling methods for different types of data and research scenarios.
Analyzing the effectiveness of statistical estimators for reliable estimations.
Formulate a suitable hypothesis, make informed decisions based on data, and draw valid conclusions.

units.title: Introduction to Estimation
topics: Population and Sample, Statistic and Parameter

units.title: Fundamentals of Inference
topics: Null and Alternate Hypothesis, Type-I and Type-II Errors
Level of Significance, Critical Region, P-Value

units.title: Hypothesis Testing I
topics: Test of Significance of Single Proportion
Test of Significance of Difference of Proportions
Test of Significance for Single Mean and difference of two means

units.title: Hypothesis Testing II
topics: t-distribution and t-tests (Single Mean, Difference, Paired)

textBooks: Probability and Statistics for Computer Scientists, Michael Baron, 3rd Edition, Chapman and Hall, 2019
Fundamental of Mathematical Statistics, S.C Gupta and V.K Kapoor, 12th Edition, Sultan Chand and Sons, 2020
referenceBooks: Probability & Statistics for Engineers & Scientists, Ronal E. Walpole, et al., 9th Edition, Pearson, 2016
courseOutcomes: Apply appropriate sampling methods for different types of data and research scenarios.
Analyzing the effectiveness of statistical estimators for reliable estimations.
Formulate a suitable hypothesis, make informed decisions based on data, and draw valid conclusions.

name: Algorithm Analysis Laboratory
description: A laboratory course focused on the practical implementation and analysis of various algorithm design strategies.
objectives: Implement programs to solve computational problems using suitable algorithm design strategy.
Evaluate the asymptotic performance of algorithms and write formal correctness proof for algorithms.
Conduct experiments to choose appropriate algorithms for the given real time problem.
courseOutcomes: Implement programs to solve computational problems using suitable algorithm design strategy.
Evaluate the asymptotic performance of algorithms and write formal correctness proof for algorithms.
Conduct experiments to choose appropriate algorithms for the given real time problem.

name: Universal Human Values
description: A course on universal human values to promote ethical and responsible behavior.

name: Java Programming
description: A lab-based course on core Java programming concepts including data types, collections, exception handling, and packages.
objectives: Apply the core concepts of Java to build console-based applications.
Analyze the need of Java collection framework to handle group of objects.
Design and implement robust and modular Java applications using modern integrated tools.
labExperiments: Wrapper Classes, Boxing and Unboxing mechanisms.
courseOutcomes: Apply the core concepts of Java to build console-based applications.
Analyze the need of Java collection framework to handle group of objects.
Design and implement robust and modular Java applications using modern integrated tools.

name: Physical Education
description: A non-credit mandatory course focusing on physical education.

name: Deep Learning
description: A comprehensive course on deep learning, covering perceptrons, backpropagation, deep feedforward networks, CNNs, and RNNs.
objectives: Apply back propagation and supervised learning techniques to train neural networks.
Analyze and implement regularization techniques and convolutional networks to enhance model performance.
Evaluate the architecture and applications of recurrent neural networks.

units.title: Introduction to Neural Networks
topics: Multilayer Perceptron and Back Propagation Algorithm

units.title: Convolutional Networks (CNN)
topics: Training a CNN - Backpropagation through Convolutions

textBooks: Deep Learning, lan Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, Aaron Courville, MIT press, 2016.
Neural Networks and Deep Learning, Charu C Agarwal, 1st Edition, Springer, 2016.
referenceBooks: Pattern Recognition and Machine Learning, Christopher M. Bishop, Springer, 2006.
courseOutcomes: Apply back propagation and supervised learning techniques to train neural networks.
Analyze and implement regularization techniques and convolutional networks to enhance model performance.
Evaluate the architecture and applications of recurrent neural networks.

name: Computer Networks
description: This course covers the fundamentals of computer networking, from network architecture and protocols to internetworking, transport protocols, and security.
objectives: Apply protocols and routing mechanism principles and practices for error free data transmission over a network.
Analyze IP mechanisms for designing and implementing appropriate network requirements.
Examine various security mechanisms to protect data from various network attacks.

units.title: End to End Protocols and Congestion Control
topics: TCP congestion control and congestion avoidance

textBooks: Computer Networks: A Systems Approach, Larry L Peterson and Bruce S Davie, 5th Edition, Morgan Kufmann, 2021.
referenceBooks: Computer Networking: A Top-Down Approach Featuring the Internet, JamesKurose and Keith Ross, 8th Edition, Pearson, 2021.
courseOutcomes: Apply protocols and routing mechanism principles and practices for error free data transmission over a network.
Analyze IP mechanisms for designing and implementing appropriate network requirements.
Examine various security mechanisms to protect data from various network attacks.

name: Statistical Modeling
description: This course covers statistical modeling techniques including simple and multiple linear regression, logistic regression, and Hidden Markov Models.
objectives: Apply the concepts of statistical modeling on quantitative and qualitative data.
Analyze mathematical methods to solve problems involving stochasticity.
Design and conduct experiments for real time data using modern tools.

units.title: Multiple Linear Regression
topics: Estimation of Model parameters, Gauss-Markov Theorem

units.title: Model Diagnostics and Validation
topics: Model Validation: AIC, BIC, Mallow's Cp Criterion

units.title: Categorical Data Analysis
topics: Logistic Regression Models and ROC Curves

units.title: Hidden Markov Models
topics: HMM Training, Gaussian Mixture Models with HMMs

textBooks: Introduction to Linear Regression Analysis, Douglas Montgomery, Elizabeth A. Peck, G. Geoffrey vining, Wiley.
An Introduction to Categorical data analysis, Alan Agresti, Wiley, 3 Edition, 2019.
referenceBooks: Applied Linear Regression Models, Michael H. Kutner, et al., 4th Edition, McGraw-Hill, 2004.
courseOutcomes: Apply the concepts of statistical modeling on quantitative and qualitative data.
Analyze mathematical methods to solve problems involving stochasticity.
Design and conduct experiments for real time data using modern tools.

name: Data Analysis and Visualization
description: This course covers data analysis steps, data processing, exploratory data analysis, and various data visualization techniques and systems.
objectives: Understand and interpret data plots and core data visualization concepts.
Explore the relationship between two continuous variables using scatter plots and line plots.
Develop proficiency in crafting visually engaging representations of complex datasets.
topics: Visualization of Networks and Volumetric Data

units.title: Data Processing and Exploratory Data Analysis
topics: Handling Missing data, Data Transformation, Data Wrangling

units.title: Introduction to Visualization
topics: Statistical charts (Bar, Line, Histogram, Pie, Box Plot, Scatter plot)

units.title: Advanced Visualization Techniques
topics: Visualization of groups, trees, graphs, clusters, networks
Visualization of text and text documents

units.title: Specialized Visualization
topics: Visualization of volumetric data, vector fields
Visualization of maps, geographic information, GIS systems

textBooks: Interactive Data Visualization: Foundations, Techniques, and Applications Ward, Grinstein Keim,. Natick: A K Peters, Ltd, 1st Edition, 2010.
Practical Statistics for Data Scientists, Peter Bruce, Andrew Bruce & Peter Gedeck, 2nd Edition, 2020.
referenceBooks: Data Visualization: A Practical Introduction Kieran Healy, 1st Edition, 2018.
courseOutcomes: To understand and interpret data plots core data visualization concepts such as correlation, linear relationships, and log scales.
To explore the relationship between two continuous variables using scatter plots and line plots.
Develop proficiency in crafting visually engaging representations of complex datasets, ensuring clarity and accessibility for diverse audiences.

name: Nature Inspired Computing
description: This course explores computing paradigms inspired by nature, including Swarm Intelligence, Genetic Algorithms, and other nature-inspired optimization algorithms.
objectives: Comprehend the needs for present and future computing paradigm changes with examples found in the real world.
Apply the Nature Inspired Computing approaches in the context of problem-solving.
Analyze the emulation of natural phenomena in computers.

units.title: Nature Inspired Algorithms
topics: Social spider algorithm, Harmony search algorithm

textBooks: Leandro Nunes de Castro, "Fundamentals of Natural Computing, Basic Concepts, Algorithms and Applications", Chapman & Hall/ CRC, Taylor and Francis Group, 2007.
referenceBooks: Floreano D. and Mattiussi C., "Bio-Inspired Artificial Intelligence: Theories, Methods, and Technologies", MIT Press, Cambridge, MA, 2008.
courseOutcomes: Comprehend the needs for present and future computing paradigm changes with examples found in the real world.
Apply the Nature Inspired Computing approaches in the context of problem-solving.
Analyze the emulation of natural phenomena in computers.

name: Environmental Studies
description: A mandatory course on environmental studies.

name: Professional Elective - 1
description: Professional Elective course. Options include Digital Image Processing, Knowledge Discovery, Internet of Things, and Product, services and IT service management.

name: Mini Project Work
description: A mini project to develop machine learning/deep learning projects by adopting various technologies, evaluated in two reviews.
objectives: Assess research methods and algorithms to tackle real-world engineering challenges.
Apply domain knowledge to create a practical solution addressing societal and engineering challenges.
Demonstrate effective collaboration to document and present implemented solutions.
courseOutcomes: Assess research methods and algorithms in technical literature to tackle real-world engineering challenges through prior knowledge application and thorough investigation.
Apply domain knowledge and relevant technologies to create a practical solution addressing societal and engineering challenges through the development of a mini project.
Demonstrate effective collaboration within the team to document and collectively present the implemented solutions.

name: Research Methodology
description: This course introduces research methodology, including defining research problems, literature review, research design, data collection, and report writing.
objectives: Analyze and apply relevant research methods and techniques.
Distinguishing qualitative and quantitative research types.
Demonstrate enhanced research writing skills using modern tools.

units.title: Data Collection
topics: Collection of Primary and Secondary Data

textBooks: Research Methodology: Methods and Techniques, C.R. Kothari and Gaurav Garg, 4th Edition, New Age International, 2018.
referenceBooks: Research Methodology a step-by step guide for beginners, Ranjit Kumar, 3rd Edition, SAGE Publications, 2011.
courseOutcomes: Analyze and apply relevant research methods and techniques appropriate to identified research study.
Distinguishing qualitative and quantitative research types.
Demonstrate enhanced research writing skills using modern tools like LaTeX, EndNote and alike.

name: Physical Education
description: A non-credit mandatory course focusing on physical education.

name: Software Engineering and Project Management
description: This course covers software engineering principles, process models, requirements engineering, software metrics, design patterns, testing strategies, and project management techniques.
objectives: Apply techniques, principles and practices for requirements to managing the software systems.
Analyze software requirements, models and metrics for developing quality software.
Design, demonstrate and document the solutions for given software including project management.

units.title: Overview of Software Engineering
topics: Process Models (Waterfall, V-Model, Spiral, Agile, Scrum)

units.title: Software Metrics and Modeling
topics: Size-Oriented Metrics, Halsted Metrics, Cyclomatic Complexity
Unified Modeling Language (Use Cases, Class, Sequence diagrams)

units.title: Software Testing
topics: Black Box Testing (Equivalence Partitioning, Boundary Value Analysis)

units.title: Patterns
topics: Architectural Patterns: Layers, Pipes and Filters

textBooks: Software engineering: a practitioner's approach, Roger S. Pressman, Palgrave macmillan, 7th Edition, 2017.
Pattern-Oriented Software Architecture A System of Patterns, Frank Buschmann, et al., Volume 1, Wiley, 1996.
referenceBooks: Software Engineering, Sommerville, I., Pearson Education Limited, 10th Edition, 2017.
courseOutcomes: Apply techniques, principles and practices for requirements to managing the software systems.
Analyze software requirements, models and metrics for developing quality software.
Design, demonstrate and document the solutions for given software including project management.

name: Parallel Architectures and Programming
description: This course covers parallel computer architecture, memory subsystems, pipelining, and GPU programming with CUDA.
objectives: Assess the performance and scalability of parallel programming solutions.
Demonstrate proficiency in CUDA programming language and its applications.
Apply optimization techniques to enhance the performance of GPU-accelerated applications.

units.title: Introduction to Parallel Computer Architecture
topics: Computer Architecture vs Parallel Computer Architecture

units.title: Principles of Pipelining and Vector Processing
Computer Unified Device Architecture (CUDA)
topics: Parallelism and program structure of CUDA

textBooks: Computer architecture and Parallel processing, Kai Hwang and Briggs, McGraw-Hill.
CUDA By Example, Jason Sanders, Edward Kandrot, Addison_Wesley.
referenceBooks: Introduction to Parallel Computing, Ananth Grama, et al., Pearson Education.
courseOutcomes: Assess the performance and scalability of parallel programming solutions.
Demonstrate proficiency in CUDA programming language and its applications in various domains.
Apply optimization techniques to enhance the performance of GPU-accelerated applications.

name: Autoencoders and Generative AI
description: This course covers autoencoders, Restricted Boltzmann Machines, deep generative models, and Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs).
objectives: Apply deep generative models for various data types and evaluate their performance.
Analyze the architecture and applications of generative AI, including large language models (LLMs).
Evaluate the principles and challenges of training Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs).

units.title: Restricted Boltzmann Machines and Representation Learning
Deep Generative Models
topics: Deep Belief Networks, Deep Boltzmann Machines
Directed Generative Nets, Generative Stochastic Networks

units.title: Introduction to Generative Al
topics: Overview and applications of generative Al

units.title: Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs)
topics: GAN Architectures: Vanilla GAN, DCGAN, Conditional GANs

textBooks: Deep Learning, lan Goodfellow, Yoshua Bengio, and Aaron Courville, MIT Press, 2016.
GANs in Action, Jakub Langr and Vladimir Bok, Manning Publications, 2019.
referenceBooks: Generative Deep Learning, David Foster, O'Reilly, Second Edition.
courseOutcomes: Apply deep generative models for various data types and evaluate their performance.
Analyze the architecture and applications of generative AI, including large language models (LLMs).
Evaluate the principles and challenges of training Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs).

name: Reinforcement Learning
description: This course introduces reinforcement learning, covering Markov Decision Processes, dynamic programming, Monte Carlo methods, temporal-difference learning, and deep reinforcement learning.
objectives: Analyze Markov Decision Processes and implement dynamic programming and Monte Carlo methods.
Apply temporal-difference learning techniques, including Sarsa and Q-learning.
Evaluate the use of eligibility traces and planning techniques in reinforcement learning.

units.title: Markov Decision Processes and Dynamic Programming
topics: Agent-Environment Interface, Value Functions, Bellman Equation

units.title: Monte Carlo Methods and Temporal-Difference Learning
Eligibility Traces and Transfer Learning
topics: n-Step prediction, Forward and Backward View of TD

textBooks: Reinforcement learning: An introduction, Richard S.Sutton and Andrew G. Barto, MIT Press, 2019.
referenceBooks: Deep Reinforcement Learning Hands-On, Maxim Lapan, Packt Publishing, 2018.
courseOutcomes: Analyze Markov Decision Processes and implement dynamic programming and Monte Carlo methods for policy evaluation and improvement.
Apply temporal-difference learning techniques, including Sarsa and Q-learning, to optimize decision-making in reinforcement learning environments.
Evaluate the use of eligibility traces and planning techniques in reinforcement learning.

name: Soft Computing Lab
description: A lab course on soft computing techniques, including fuzzy logic, genetic algorithms, and nature-inspired optimization algorithms.
objectives: Apply the concepts of soft computing techniques for real-world scenario.
Analyze nature-inspired optimization algorithms in the computer engineering field.
Design solutions for real time problems using modern tools.
courseOutcomes: Apply the concepts of soft computing techniques for real-world scenario.
Analyze nature-inspired optimization algorithms in the computer engineering field.
Design solutions for real time problems using modern tools.

name: Professional Elective - 2
description: Professional Elective course. Options include Computer Vision, Big Data Analytics, and Robotic Process Automation.

name: Open Elective - 1
description: Open Elective course. Options include Introduction to Artificial Intelligence, Introduction to Machine Learning, and Introduction to Neural Networks.

name: Project work -1
description: The first phase of a two-semester project, focusing on literature survey, problem statement definition, and high-level design.
objectives: Synthesize existing knowledge thorough literature review to identify gaps in existing system.
Develop a comprehensive project proposal, including objectives, scope, and deliverables.
Prepare and present a progress report summarizing the project's high-level and detailed design.
courseOutcomes: Synthesize existing knowledge thorough literature review to identify gaps in existing system.
Develop a comprehensive project proposal, including objectives, scope, deliverables and justify their project's relevance.
Prepare and present a progress report summarizing their project high level and detailed design.

name: Machine Learning Operations (MLOPS)
description: A lab-based course on MLOps, covering data ingestion, model training, deployment, monitoring, and CI/CD pipelines.
objectives: Comprehend the complete process from data preparation to monitoring and maintenance.
Leverage MLOps principles and tools to efficiently scale, manage, and automate model deployment.
Acquire skills to select the ideal MLOps stack and leverage Git and GitOps.
labExperiments: Model Deployment (REST API with Flask/FastAPI, Docker)
Automated Testing and CI/CD Pipeline (Jenkins, GitHub Actions)
Orchestration with Workflow Management Tools (Airflow, Kubeflow)
Collaboration and Version Control with Git and GitOps
textBooks: Machine Practical MLOps, by Noah Gift, Alfredo Deza, Released September 2021 Publisher(s): O'Reilly Media, Inc.
referenceBooks: Introducing MLOps, by Mark Treveil, et al., Released November 2020, Publisher(s): O'Reilly Media, Inc.
courseOutcomes: Comprehend the complete process from data preparation, model training, evaluation, and deployment to monitoring and maintenance.
Leverage MLOps principles and tools to efficiently scale, manage, and automate the deployment of machine learning models in production environments.
Acquire the skills to select the ideal MLOps stack and leverage Git and GitOps for efficient version control and seamless collaboration in machine learning initiatives.

name: Physical Education
description: A non-credit mandatory course focusing on physical education.

name: Time Series Analysis
description: This course covers time series analysis, including components of time series, forecasting techniques, stationary and non-stationary models (ARMA, ARIMA), and models of heteroscedasticity (ARCH, GARCH).
objectives: Apply effective techniques on time-dependent information to construct predictive models.
Develop skills in identifying appropriate time series models using diagnostic tools and statistical inference.
Develop time series and financial models tailored for real-time applications.
topics: Stationary Time Series Models (AR, MA, ARMA)

units.title: Introduction to Time Series
topics: Time series components (Trend, Seasonal, Cyclical, Irregular)

units.title: Stationary Time Series Models
topics: AR Process, MA Process, ARMA Process

units.title: Non-Stationary Time Series Models
topics: Random walk process, Dicky Fuller Unit Root Test

units.title: Time Series Models of Heteroscedasticity
topics: Model Identification using ACF and PACF

labExperiments: Fitting AR, MA, ARMA, ARIMA Models
textBooks: Introduction to Time Series Analysis and Forecasting, Douglas C. Montgomery, Cheryl L. Jennings, Murat Kulahci, 2nd Edition, Wiley, 2015.
referenceBooks: Hands-On Time Series Analysis with R, Rami Krispin, Packt Publishing Ltd, 2019.
courseOutcomes: Apply effective techniques on time-dependent information to construct predictive models and facilitate decision-making processes.
Develop skills in identifying appropriate time series models by utilizing a range of diagnostic tools and statistical inference techniques.
Develop time series and financial models tailored for real-time applications.

name: Natural Language Processing for LLM
description: This course covers Natural Language Processing (NLP) with a focus on Large Language Models (LLMs), including text preprocessing, text representation, language modeling, Transformers architecture, prompt engineering, and Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback (RLHF).
objectives: Apply foundations of natural language processing to build NLP applications.
Analyze NLP tasks using existing algorithms.
Conduct experiments to implement building blocks of NLP.

units.title: Reinforcement Learning with Human Feedback
topics: RLHF: Reward model, Fine-tuning with reinforcement learning

textBooks: Speech and Language Processing: An introduction to Natural Language Processing, Computational Linguistics and Speech Recognition, Daniel Jurafsky, James H Martin, 3rd Edition, Prentice Hall, 2024.
referenceBooks: Natural Language Processing with Transformers: Building Language Applications with Hugging Face, Lewis Tunstall, Leandro von Werra, Thomas Wolf, O'Reilly Media, Inc, 2022.
courseOutcomes: Apply foundations of natural language processing in linguistics and formal language theory to build NLP applications.
Analyze NLP tasks using existing algorithms.
Conduct experiments to implement building blocks of NLP.

name: Professional Elective - 3
description: Professional Elective course. Options include Video Analytics using OpenCV, Social Network Analysis, and Cyber Physical Systems.

name: Open Elective - 2
description: Open Elective course. Options include Introduction to AI, Introduction to Machine Learning, and Introduction to Neural Networks.

name: Project work-2
description: The second phase of the project, focusing on the implementation, testing, and completion of the project defined in Phase 1.

name: Indian Knowledge Systems
description: A course on Indian Knowledge Systems.

name: Professional Elective - 4
description: Professional Elective course. Options include Financial Mathematics, Financial Management, and Entrepreneurship and Management.

name: Open Elective - 3
description: Open Elective course. Options include Introduction to AI, Introduction to Machine Learning, and Introduction to Neural Networks.

name: Internship
description: A mandatory internship of 16-20 weeks to provide practical industry experience.
